result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory S Walker in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Gregory S Walker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF326, 13CF443 and 14CF181 

2:11 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Case's are to be heard today regarding restitution.
Atty Knaapen makes statements that there was no restitution on 13CF326 so will not be affected by the outcome of today's hearing.
Atty Knaapen states that there is restitution on 13CF443 and that 14CF181 had been DRI,
Total restitution is $7,881.31 with $6,000 owed on 13CF443 and $1,881.31 on 14CF181.
State has complied with the victim notification but no victim's appear in Court today.
Parties have stipulated to the restitution in the amount of $491.08 with $83 being paid to China Wok and $408.08 to Bev's Floral.

BY THE COURT:
Due to no victim's appearing in Court today the stipulated amount is approved.
Court approves the restitution in the amount of $491.08 with $83 being paid to China Wok and $408.08 to Bev's Floral.
Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to reflect the restitution amount.
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpuse Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 10/13/16 - original filed in 13CF326

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory S Walker in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Gregory S Walker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF326 & 13CF443 (14CF181 - all counts were DRI).

9:03 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Schmidt makes a statement indicating that he is not able to proceed with the sentencing today; he did provide the Court with
and Order releasing the PSI.  
Atty Schmidt is requesing an adjournment.
Court questions the defendants incarceration; Atty Schmidt responds.
Atty Knaapen makes statements in regards to the defendant being in approval of the continuance.
Court does a brief colloquy with the defendant.
Defendand is in agreement with the adjournment.

BY THE COURT:
Court signed the order for release of PSI. 
Sentencing hearing re-scheduled.

records.addlTxt:
10:43 a.m. Defendant Gregory S Walker in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Gregory S Walker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Requesting a prison sentence, 2012 PSI report to be used.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF326 Count 1: Guilty
13CF443 Count 1: Guilty


Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
14CF181 is dismised and read in.


BY THE COURT:***PSI Report from 2012 to be sent to the Judge
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 05/02/16

Pre-trial conference at 06-29-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Gregory S Walker in court with attorney Paul M Goetz. Defendant Gregory S Walker in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared on behalf of David Knaapen for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF326 and 14CF181.

9:39 a.m. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court makes statements that this was set for a Jury Trial but that the defendant did not want to meet with his Attorney.
Court questions the defendant and the defendant responds.
Defendant states that he wants an Attorney that will defend him to charges he is not guilty of.
Atty Goetz states that he was appointed by the Public Defender.
Court questions the defendant and he states that he is currently represented by Atty Suzanne O'Neill on other cases.
Court questions Atty Goetz as to what he would like to see happen.
Atty Goetz states that he would like to withdraw as counsel for this defendant and states his reasons on the record.
Atty Cousins makes statements in regards to the cases set for Trial today.
Atty Goetz states there are 3 files that he has been appointed to and would like to withdraw - those cases are 13CF326, 13CF443 and 14CF181.
Atty Cousins states that the 3 files have a cash bond.

BY THE COURT:
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel GRANTED to Atty Goetz on cases 13CF326, 13CF443 and 14CF181.
Bond is ordered continued.
